A **yellow light**, y, is a type of monster that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. The yellow light is the only other member of the [light](/wiki/Light_\(monster_class\) "Light (monster class)") [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") along with the [black light](/wiki/Black_light "Black light"). It is [amorphous](/wiki/Amorphous "Amorphous"), can [fly](/wiki/Fly "Fly") and flow under [doors](/wiki/Door "Door"), and act as a 3x3 [light](/wiki/Light "Light") source.

A yellow light has an [explosion](/wiki/Explosion "Explosion") attack directed at a target monster's square that destroys the yellow light, wakes nearby [sleeping](/wiki/Sleeping "Sleeping") monsters and [blinds](/wiki/Blind "Blind") any monster hit for 10d20 turns. The attack is ineffective on targets that cannot see, and if the yellow light is invisible and a character cannot [see invisible](/wiki/See_invisible "See invisible"), there is an [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level")-based chance that its explosion will have no effect.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) A yellow light possesses every resistance [property](/wiki/Property "Property") minus [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance").

[ ]

## Generation

Randomly-generated yellow lights are always hostile.

In addition to normal random generation, [reading](/wiki/Read "Read") a non-[cursed](/wiki/Cursed "Cursed") [scroll of light](/wiki/Scroll_of_light "Scroll of light") while confused has a 1⁄5 chance of generating a yellow light unless they are [genocided](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide").

The second variant of [Medusa's Island](/wiki/Medusa%27s_Island "Medusa's Island") has a yellow light in the back room of the hall [Medusa](/wiki/Medusa "Medusa") inhabits, and three yellow lights are generated on the [Plane of Air](/wiki/Plane_of_Air "Plane of Air").

Yellow lights [never leave a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless") upon death.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit 1ba1422e](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/1ba1422eba147c875ea90c1d0456511a8519cecf) (partly adapted from [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack")), reading a non-cursed scroll of light while confused will instead summon multiple [tame](/wiki/Tame "Tame") [cancelled](/wiki/Cancelled "Cancelled") yellow lights if they are not genocided. An uncursed scroll will summon 3–4 yellow lights, while a blessed scroll will summon 5–6 yellow lights.

## Strategy

While it is possible to kill yellow lights normally for characters that can deal with their 0 [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") and fast, erratic movement, it is usually preferable to let them explode while the character is already blinded: a [blindfold](/wiki/Blindfold "Blindfold") or [towel](/wiki/Towel "Towel") is one of the most straightforward methods of making yellow lights harmless, and a [unicorn horn](/wiki/Unicorn_horn "Unicorn horn") or curative spell (e.g., [extra healing](/wiki/Spellbook_of_extra_healing "Spellbook of extra healing") and [cure blindness](/wiki/Spellbook_of_cure_blindness "Spellbook of cure blindness")) also make them trivial to deal with. Yellow lights also cannot see invisible - if their target is [invisible](/wiki/Invisible "Invisible") or has [displacement](/wiki/Displacement "Displacement"), they may harmlessly explode at the square that the light perceives them to be at.

Be careful of dealing with yellow lights in or around rooms such as [treasure zoos](/wiki/Treasure_zoo "Treasure zoo") or [throne rooms](/wiki/Throne_room "Throne room") - a light that explodes close to the room will wake many (if not all) of the inhabitants.

## History

Yellow lights have been present since Hack121, a variant of [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack").

## Messages

- You get the impression it was not terribly bright.

  An invisible yellow light exploded, and you were unaffected by it.

- You have a melancholy feeling for a moment, then it passes.

  A [tame](/wiki/Tame "Tame") yellow light exploded.

## Variants

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), reading a non-cursed scroll of light while confused will instead summon multiple [tame](/wiki/Tame "Tame") [cancelled](/wiki/Cancelled "Cancelled") yellow lights if they are not genocided. An uncursed scroll will summon 3–4 yellow lights, while a blessed scroll will summon 5–6 yellow lights.

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), yellow lights emit a 2-square radius of light around themselves, and their explosion attack affects all monsters adjacent to it.

## Encyclopedia entry

Strange creatures formed from energy rather than matter,  
lights are given to self-destructive behavior when battling  
foes.

## References
